page.title: 04WYTHALL NURSERY
page.content: { WYTHALL NURSERY}has been owned by the Moseleys since 1894 and the adjacent farmland since the 17th century.The Moseleys grow their delicate plants in pots as the soil in and around Wythall is too heavy for planting. Some plants are grown in oil-heated greenhouses. Sometimes the temperature in the green houses is as high as 80-85C.They use chemical and organic fertilizer.They sell their produce to {Birmingham {Wholesale Market}but they also have a stall in the Bullring Shopping Centre.The Moseleys like living and working in Wythall, though they did say that they liked it a lot more in the old days when fewer people lived here.Their hope for the future is that their children will carry on the nursery that their greatgrandad started. {SILVERMEAD }
